\begin{document}
\title{Math 320 HW 4}
\date{Due: Feb. 13, 2024 at 11:59 PM}
\maketitle

\section*{1)}

Create a Cayley digraph for each of the following groups. What is
the minimum number of generators needed to create the group?
\begin{enumerate}
\item $D_{3}$
\item $S_{3}$
\end{enumerate}

\section*{2)}

The digraphs below are not valid Cayley Digraphs. Explain why each
one is not.

\subsection*{a)}

\includegraphics[scale=0.5]{\string"../../Math 320 Spring 2023/HW/HW 3/2a\string".eps}

\subsection*{b)}

\includegraphics[scale=0.5]{\string"../../Math 320 Spring 2023/HW/HW 3/2b\string".eps}

\section*{3)}

Rewrite the following cycles as a product of 2-cycles and as a product
of disjoint cycles.
\begin{enumerate}
\item $\left(631\right)\left(1247\right)\left(5\right)$
\item $\left[\begin{array}{cccccc}
1 & 2 & 3 & 4 & 5 & 6\\
6 & 5 & 3 & 1 & 2 & 4
\end{array}\right]$
\end{enumerate}

\section*{5)}
\begin{enumerate}
\item Draw a shape with $D_{5}$ symmetry
\item Draw a shape with $C_{6}$ symmetry
\end{enumerate}

\section*{6)}

For subgroups $H,K\leq G$, show $H\cap K$ is a subgroup of $G$.
Is $H\cup K$ a subgroup of $G$? If so, prove it. Otherwise, provide
a counterexample.

\section*{7)}

The center $Z\left(G\right)$ of group $G$ is defined as follows:

\[
Z\left(G\right)=\left\{ a\in G|ax=xa\ \forall x\in G\right\} 
\]

Show $Z\left(G\right)$ forms a subgroup of $G$.
\end{document}
